author: Sarah Norrad
title: We are One. {Poetry}
text:
If we could become still for a moment, 
we would see— 
we are made from the flesh of her flesh. 

This tender sadness we feel right now, 
it is because we have forgotten. 
We have been neglecting to care for the one who gave us life. 

If we could become still for a moment, 
we would see— 
we are made of the same matter that she is constructed of. 

Her heartbeat pulses in everything. 

If we could become still for a moment, 
we would hear 
the pitter-patter of preciousness that she holds, 
that we hold too. 
There’s no way to separate her body from our body. 

If we could become still for a moment, 
we would see— 
the ache that courses through her bones 
is the same one that does in ours. 

Our earth needs our healing. 
She and we are yearning to be united as one. 

If we could become still for a moment, 
we would see— 
we must put our skin upon her skin again, 
and touch her lightly now. 

If we become still for a moment, 
we would see— 
there’s no way we can separate her body from our body. 

How could we have abandoned her like this? 
How could we have turned away from our original mother? 

If we could become still for a moment, 
we would see 
that we must protect her, 
the life-giver of us all. 

Our earth needs our saving. 
She needs to know that our feet are grateful 
to step upon her body once more. 

If we could become still for a moment, 
we would see— 
we must remove the layers we have placed between us, 
so we can feel her rawness beneath us 
now. 
We have believed in a construction of disconnection, 
but this is untrue. 
If we could become still for a moment, we would see 
that we were never standing alone.
